text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Amiga CD32 is a fourth generation video game console released by Commodore in 1993. It is essentially an Amiga 1200 with a CD drive. Technically the first 32-bit console to be released in the West, the FM Towns Marty was released before it in Japan. Like the 3DO and the Jaguar, the CD32 failed to break into the market in the face of the PSX and Saturn. Despite the 32-bit architecture, the CD32 lacked the sophisticated 3D visuals of its competition. It would be discontinued only 8 months after its debut. Some CDTV games are compatible with the CD32.
